title: Authors and Citation
text: Massari N, Zhong M, Götschmann M, Walder C, Schöbitz L (2025). fairenough: Automated R Data Package Creation AI-Powered Documentation. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/openwashdata/fairenough.
code: @Manual{,   title = {fairenough: Automated R Data Package Creation with AI-Powered Documentation},   author = {Nicolo Massari and Mian Zhong and Margaux Götschmann and Colin Walder and Lars Schöbitz},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/openwashdata/fairenough}, }

title: fairenough
text: Convert tidy data R packages documentation websites intelligent AI descriptions.

title: fairenough
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("openwashdata/fairenough")

title: fairenough
text: simplest experience, move datasets empty directory, run main fairenough() function: automatically: - Sets R package structure - Processes CSV/Excel files directory - Collects package metadata interactive prompts - Builds documentation, citation files, README, website - Generates intelligent data documentation using LLMs - Prepares package publication
code: library(fairenough)  # Set up your LLM chat object Sys.setenv(OPENAI_API_KEY = "YOUR_API_TOKEN_HERE") chat <- elmer::chat_openai(model = "gpt-4o-mini", api_args = list(temperature = 0.3))  # Run the complete pipeline with one command fairenough(chat)

title: fairenough
text: step--step control, use individual wrapper functions:
code: library(fairenough)  # Step 1: Initialize project structure setup()  # Step 2: Process your data files process()  # Step 3: Collect package metadata collect()  # Step 4: Generate LLM-powered documentation chat <- elmer::chat_openai(model = "gpt-4o-mini", api_args = list(temperature = 0.3)) generate(chat)  # Step 5: Build all package components build()

title: fairenough
text: fairenough provides complete pipeline R data package creation, following logical steps: fairenough() - One-Click Pipeline Complete R data package creation single fairenough(chat) call Automated workflow tidy data finished package Args: Supports flags can passed individual wrapper functions Granular Control Options Individual wrapper functions: setup(), process(), collect(), generate(), build() Global support args: overwrite = TRUE verbose = TRUE 1. setup() - R Project Setup R package structure initialization usethis Directory files organization (data_raw, .gitignore, etc.) 2. process() - Automated Data Processing Processes tidy data readr, readxl Validates data structure formats Arg: auto_clean = TRUE automated minimal data cleaning tidying 3. collect() - Interactive Metadata Collection Guided prompts package metadata (title, description, authors, etc.) using cli Saves directly DESCRIPTION file desc Arg: extended = TRUE comprehensive documentation 4. generate() - LLM-Powered Documentation Data dictionary generation using elmer chat/LLM integration Variable descriptions uses package’s description context + actual data samples Arg: contex = "DATASETS CONTEXT" 5. build() - Complete Package Infrastructure Roxygen documentation generation roxygen2 Citation file creation validation using cffr README generation rmarkdown Package website building ready deployment

title: fairenough
text: MIT

title: fairenough
text: Horst , Hill AP, Gorman KB (2020). palmerpenguins: Palmer Archipelago (Antarctica) penguin data. R package version 0.1.0. https://allisonhorst.github.io/palmerpenguins/. doi: 10.5281/zenodo.3960218.

title: fairenough
text: Welcome! Philosophy Conventional commits! https://www.conventionalcommits.org/. Feature functions must maintain architectural consistency. means aspects like supported formats path handling uniform across functions. details, refer R/utils.R. test new functions: Due utility outside {fairenough}, gendict.R, build_license.R promptit.R kept general tied package’s architecture.

title: Collect comprehensive metadata interactively — collect_metadata
text: Collects metadata R data packages using interactive prompts. Supports partial pre-filling provided values used missing required fields prompted. Uses general prompt.R utilities. default, collects essential metadata. Set extended=TRUE collect additional optional metadata publication archiving.

title: Collect comprehensive metadata interactively — collect_metadata
code: collect_metadata(   pkg_name = NULL,   title = NULL,   description = NULL,   version = "0.0.1",   language = "en-GB",   github_user = NULL,   authors = NULL,   license = NULL,   keywords = NULL,   funder = NULL,   grant_id = NULL,   temporal_start = NULL,   temporal_end = NULL,   spatial_description = NULL,   spatial_coordinates = NULL,   related_identifiers = NULL,   communities = NULL,   extended = FALSE,   interactive = TRUE,   save_to_desc = TRUE,   base_path = NULL,   overwrite = FALSE )

title: Collect comprehensive metadata interactively — collect_metadata
text: pkg_name Package name title Package title description Package description (one paragraph) version Package version (default: "0.0.1") language Language code (default: "en-GB") github_user GitHub username organization authors List author information license License identifier (e.g., "CC--4.0") keywords Character vector keywords (prompted extended=TRUE) funder Funding organization (prompted extended=TRUE) grant_id Grant identifier (prompted extended=TRUE) temporal_start Start date data coverage (prompted extended=TRUE) temporal_end End date data coverage (prompted extended=TRUE) spatial_description Geographic coverage description (prompted extended=TRUE) spatial_coordinates List lat lon (prompted extended=TRUE) related_identifiers List related publications (prompted extended=TRUE) communities Character vector Zenodo communities (prompted extended=TRUE) extended Whether prompt extended metadata fields (default: FALSE) interactive Whether use interactive prompts (default: TRUE) save_to_desc Whether save DESCRIPTION file (default: TRUE) base_path Base path project overwrite Whether overwrite existing metadata (default: FALSE)

title: Collect comprehensive metadata interactively — collect_metadata

title: Setup fairenough project structure — setup_package

title: Setup fairenough project structure — setup_package

title: Setup fairenough project structure — setup_package
text: raw_dir Name raw data directory (default: "data_raw") gitignore Whether add data_raw .gitignore (default: TRUE) base_path Base path project (default: uses get_base_path()) verbose Whether show detailed messages (default: TRUE) overwrite Whether overwrite existing files (default: FALSE)
